conclusion: A drives in from the lower right direction towards the group of blocks and the task is to determine which blocks A will collide with and where it will eventually stop.
The toy car A is positioned in the lower right corner of the image, facing towards a cluster of blocks.
The cluster of blocks contains cubes of different colors: red, green, yellow, orange, blue, and purple.
The red cube is positioned lowest in the cluster, closest to the toy car A's approach line.
The toy car A’s approach line from the lower-right points straight at the lone red cube that sits lowest in the cluster, so the red cube is the first object it strikes.
The impact with the red cube robs the car of most of its energy but still leaves it sliding a short additional distance.
After the glancing contact with the red cube, the car’s new heading turns a few degrees to the left, carrying it into the green cube that had been just behind the red one.
The second, lighter collision with the green cube absorbs the little momentum A has left.
After nudging the green block, A runs out of forward power and settles almost in the middle of the cluster, roughly where the red cube had originally been.
Second (softer) collision: green cube that was just up-and-left of the red cube.
Final resting place of A: near the center of the group, a bit left of its original entry line, essentially at the red cube’s former location.
